definition: to throw down/to fall/to drop and break

sentences.english: Han hero killed immediately, the river water would drown people.
sentences.chinese: 马上摔死英雄汉，河中淹死会水人。

sentences.english: Can't the meeting get rid of in this spot after the another place falls dead?
sentences.chinese: 会不会是在别的地方摔死后扔弃在这个现场的？

sentences.english: She lost her balance and plunged 100 feet to her death.
sentences.chinese: 她没有站稳，从100英尺的高处跌下摔死了。

sentences.english: A bird fell to the ground, dead.
sentences.chinese: 感觉很形象啊，鸟摔到地上摔死了。

sentences.english: Let him think that Selden died from a fall.
sentences.chinese: 就让他以为塞尔登是摔死的吧。

sentences.english: Henry always said he'd smash himself up sooner or later.
sentences.chinese: 亨利总是说他迟早会摔死的。

sentences.english: You were stupid to try climbing up there. You might have killed yourself.
sentences.chinese: 你试图在那里攀登是愚蠢的，你也许会摔死的。

sentences.english: Short while assassins will be gain and which killed two, kicked two.
sentences.chinese: 不一会刺客便被黄进芳摔死两个，踢伤两个。

sentences.english: The main goal is to hxdye fun while doing so and to preferably not die.
sentences.chinese: 主要目的就是享受攀爬乐趣，还有最好别摔死。

sentences.english: You'll break your neck if you fall off the roof.
sentences.chinese: 你要是从屋顶上跌下来会摔死的。

sentences.english: The person who certainly falls dead is also those persons who like to climb forever.
sentences.chinese: 当然摔死的人永远也是那些喜欢攀登的人。

sentences.english: I never climb down, I will slip up.
sentences.chinese: 我绝对没法爬下去，我会滑倒摔死的。

definition: to throw down/to fall/to drop and break
to lose one's footing/to slip/to take a wrong step in life
to knock down and kill sb with a car/to run over sb/to run sb down
to fall headlong/(fig.) to suffer an ignominious failure
to fall down/to slip and fall/to throw sb to the ground
to hack to death/to kill with an ax
to fall and break/to break (bones) by falling
to freeze to death/to die off in winter
